<!-- Generated by Harlequin Webmaker 2.1.3; Transducer 1.0.2 --> <HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE> Geometric and Solid Modeling</TITLE> </HEAD> <BODY> <A NAME=HEADING92></A> <A HREF="AR95Book-93.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bnext.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-91.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bprev.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-66.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bup.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Btop.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bcontent.gif"></A><BR><A HREF="AR95Book-93.html">[Next] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-91.html">[Previous] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-66.html">[Up] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html">[Top] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html">[Contents]</A> <P> <A NAME=HEADING92-0></A> <H1> Geometric and Solid Modeling</H1> Principal Investigator: <A HREF=AR95Book-26.html>Christoph M. Hoffmann</A><P> Sponsors: ONR, NSF<P> <IMG SRC="goldRule.gif" width =100%> <P> In this research all major aspects of geometric and solid modeling systems are investigated; for example, how to choose suitable representations of objects, how to efficiently implement design operations, and how to drive automatically specific surface elements from very high-level specifications. We are developing a high-level geometry representation that is feature-based and constraint-based. Ease of design and redesign are the main focus of the work, and we are developing a new architecture for CAD systems. The project maintains informal research ties with a number of related efforts both within and outside the department.<P> <IMG SRC="goldRule.gif" width =100%> <ADDRESS>CS Annual Report - 19 APR 1996</ADDRESS> <A HREF="AR95Book-93.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bnext.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-91.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bprev.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-66.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bup.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Btop.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bcontent.gif"></A><BR><A HREF="AR95Book-93.html">[Next] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-91.html">[Previous] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-66.html">[Up] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html">[Top] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html">[Contents]</A> <P> </BODY> </HTML> </HTML>
